title: Quiz of the Week: Whose statue got dunked?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Coronavirus: Couple reunited after seven-week battle against disease
description: Denise and Guy were separated for seven weeks as he was being treated for coronavirus.

title: King of Staten Island: 'There's comedy in the most difficult situations'
description: Pete Davidson and Judd Apatow tackle personal 9/11 trauma in their new film, King of Staten Island.

title: Hong Kong: City of two masks faces a new crisis
description: A year after the protests began, amid a pandemic, Hong Kong faces another existential crisis. Will it survive?

title: Coronavirus: Domestic violence 'increases globally during lockdown'
description: The UN has described the worldwide increase in domestic abuse as a "shadow pandemic".

title: Coronavirus: World From My Window sheds light on global lockdown
description: The story of Hiba, a pharmacist, is one of the many brought together in a global project.

title: The hidden detectors looking for guns and knives
description: Walk-through systems that can detect weapons are being rolled out, using a combination of AI and radar.

title: Coronavirus: How will launderettes come out in the wash?
description: Despite being an essential service, many launderette owners say their businesses are suffering during lockdown.

title: Varner III and Rose share lead as PGA Tour returns
description: American Harold Varner III birdies the 18th to take a share of the first-round lead with England's Justin Rose as the PGA Tour returned on Thursday in Texas.

title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare fix causes Xbox owners more headaches
description: Some console owners who cancelled a giant download to start again now face an even longer wait.

title: British Airways to sell art collection to raise cash
description: The airline's collection includes art by Damien Hirst and Bridget Riley, with one work worth £1m-plus.

title: Hackney police 'attack': 'We are not punch bags'
description: Home Secretary Priti Patel brands footage of a surrounded officer on the ground "disgraceful".

title: Nigel Farage leaves radio station LBC
description: The politician steps down from his talk show with "immediate effect" after talks with the station.

title: Coronavirus: Growing calls for government to scrap 2m rule
description: Conservative backbenchers say easing the restriction in England is essential for economic recovery.

title: Summer catch-up plan for England's schools pledged
description: The PM's spokesman promises an extended scheme to help pupils get back on track in England.

title: JK Rowling responds to trans tweets criticism
description: The Harry Potter author writes a blog highlighting her reasons for speaking out on gender issues.

title: Coronavirus: Could drive-in cinemas take off in the UK?
description: Watching films from the front seat of the car has never really taken off in the UK - could lockdown change that?

title: England test and trace system identifies 31,000 contacts
description: Most were reached within 24 hours and asked to self-isolate, figures show.

title: Tottenham's Alli banned for one match over coronavirus post
description: Tottenham's Dele Alli will miss their game against Manchester United after being suspended for one game for a social media post about coronavirus.

title: Harlow giant tortoise walks cause amazement, says owner
description: Peter admits his walks through Harlow with "the big boy" take a long time and do not get very far.

title: Premier League clubs back restart protocols as Covid-19 victims tributes planned
description: Premier League clubs will hold a minute's silence before the opening matches after the 2019-20 season restarts.

title: Coronavirus: Young hit hardest by lockdown financial squeeze
description: No savings and less chance to cut spending means an income fall hits the young hardest, the ONS says.

title: Racial discrimination: Armed forces told to do more to tackle issue
description: See the potential in everyone and do not allow intolerance, the UK's most senior military officer says.

title: George Floyd: The personal cost of filming police brutality
description: For bystanders who film acts of police violence, sharing their video can be a life-changing moment.

title: 'I had a prosthetic leg fitted last week, now I'm walking 10km'
description: Ex-Warwickshire batsman Andy Moles had his left leg amputated 10 weeks ago, but that is not stopping him walking 10km for charity.

title: Marmite says pub shutdown means no larger jars for now
description: Higher demand for the spread and yeast shortages have led to a halt in production of some packs.

title: Coronavirus: Major disruption to cancer care revealed
description: Charities concerned as number of patients seen following an urgent referral by a GP drop in England.

title: Schalke's Wales winger Matondo 'proud' of footballers' racism stand
description: Schalke's Wales winger Rabbi Matondo says he is "proud" of how young footballers have used their profiles to take a stand against racism.

title: Donald Trump to restart election rallies on key slavery date
description: The first campaign rally in months will take place in Tulsa, where black people were massacred in 1921.

title: George Alagiah reveals his cancer has spread
description: The BBC newsreader says the disease has spread from his bowel to his lungs.

title: Euros On This Day - 11 June: Bale stars for Wales, Henry's ridiculous pace & Euro icons go head-to-head
description: BBC Sport rounds up the best archive action from 11 June in European Championship history.

title: Couple finally meet son born to surrogate mother
description: Covid-19 travel restrictions mean newborn babies born to surrogate mothers can't be immediately united with their biological parents.

title: What do we do with statues linked to slave-traders?
description: Protesters across the UK are asking for statues and symbols across the UK to be changed or removed.

title: Surfing tragedy that stunned a Dutch beach community

title: How Fran Healy drew Travis's new video on an iPad

title: Coronavirus may have huge impact on property markets
description: As Covid-19 has hit economies, it may have a lasting impact on property sectors around the world.
